body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the order of given differential equation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left (\dfrac{d^{2}y}{dx^{2}} \right )^{4}+\int y\, dx=\cos x"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a part of "},{"type":"text","text":"10-seconds challenge","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4(\frac{d^{2}y}{dx^{2}})^{3}\frac{d^{3}y}{dx^{3}}+ y=-sinx"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, order is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 10-seconds challenge-12

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Tangent of slope "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to parabola "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^2=4(2)x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 
is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=mx +\dfrac{2}{m}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Tangent of slope "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will be :
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=2x+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies c=\boxed 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Equation of tangent on point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\color{#3D99F6}{x_1},\color{#20A900}{y_1})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on parabola is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y\color{#20A900}{y_1} = 4(x+\color{#3D99F6}{x_1})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
On comparing above equation with given equation of tangent , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y = 2x + c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow \color{#20A900}{y_1} = 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#3D99F6}{x_1} = c/2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\color{#3D99F6}{x_1},\color{#20A900}{y_1})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" lies on given parabola, "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4 = 8\left( \dfrac{c}{2}\right) \Rightarrow c = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 10-seconds challenge-5

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases} \alpha = \tan^{-1} 1 & \Rightarrow \tan \alpha = 1 \\ \beta = \tan^{-1} 2 & \Rightarrow \tan \beta = 2 \\ \gamma = \tan^{-1} 3 & \Rightarrow \tan \gamma = 3 \end{cases} \quad \Rightarrow \alpha + \beta + \gamma = n \pi  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we have:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \tan (\alpha + \beta) & = \frac{1+2}{1-(1)(2)} = - 3 \\ \tan (\alpha + \beta + \gamma) & = \frac{-3+3}{1-(-3)(3)} = 0 \\ \Rightarrow \tan n \pi & = 0 \quad \quad \small \color{#3D99F6}{\text{For } \alpha, \beta,  \gamma < \frac{\pi}{2}} \\ \Rightarrow n & = \boxed{1} \end{aligned}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan^{-1}(x)+\tan^{-1}(y)=\pi+\tan^{-1}(\dfrac{x+y}{1-xy})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"xy>1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan^{-1}(1)=\dfrac{\pi}{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan^{-1}(1)+\tan^{-1}(2)+\tan^{-1}(3)=\dfrac{\pi}{4} + \pi+ \tan^{-1}(\dfrac{2+3}{1-6})=\dfrac{\pi}{4}+\pi-\dfrac{\pi}{4}=\boxed\pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            The formula which you have mentioned is true if and only if xy>1 and x>1 as well as y>1.So,you must mention that in the solution.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Yash Dev Lamba"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/yash-dev-khh8p9/"}]},{"type":"text","text":": Nice question and solution, keep up the good work! "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But here's one formatting suggestion, try to use \tan instead of just tan(as it is now appearing), it will appear better. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ddot\smile"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \dfrac{x^{100}}{1+x+x^{2}+x^{3}+ \cdots +x^{200}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the maximum value of the expression above is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{N}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for some integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a part of "},{"type":"text","text":"10-seconds challenge","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Expression can be written as :
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{\color{#0C6AC7}{\frac{1}{x^{100}}}+\color{#D61F06}{\frac{1}{x^{99}}}+\cdots \color{#D61F06}{x^{99}}+\color{#0C6AC7}{x^{100}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Applying "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AM\geq GM"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to denominator , we can see minimum value of denominator is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"201"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Hence maximum value of expression is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{\large {\color{#20A900}{\dfrac{1}{201}}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore N=201"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Equality occurs when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 10-seconds challenge-8
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f: \mathbb R \rightarrow \mathbb R"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a continuous function "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":":"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=\int_{0}^x f(t) \, dt."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(\ln5)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a part of "},{"type":"text","text":"10-seconds challenge","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Differentiating both sides:-
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f'(x)=f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Multiplying by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^{-x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on both sides:-
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^{-x}f'(x)-e^{-x}f(x)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{d}{dx}(e^{-x}f(x))=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies e^{-x}f(x)=C"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
For some real constant "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies f(x)=Ce^x\cdots (1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Putting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the given condition (i.e "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=\int_{0}^x f(t) \, dt"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ), we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(0)=0\cdots (2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". 
From "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":-
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=0~\forall ~x\in\mathfrak R"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Hence,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(\ln 5)=\boxed 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yes, exactly! You got it! (+1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I would omit the passage "Now since we know (1) represents an exponential equation which is always greater than 0"; it's not correct and not needed for your argument: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=Ce^x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" together with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(0)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" does the job.

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            There is a flaw in each step: You are dividing by 0 and then you are taking the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ln"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of 0. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The proper way to do this kind of problem is by "},{"type":"text","text":"Integrating Factors","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            No... 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)}=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Integrating both sides 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ln(f(x))=x+C"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies f(x)=e^{x+C}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Isn't it correct?? 
Edit:- Its the same thing you have let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e^C"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as another constant!!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This solution is incorrect. From "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f'(x)=f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" you cannot infer that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=e^{x+C}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We could write "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=Ce^x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"... but do we need to justify why that works?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Put "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , clearly we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(0) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now differentiate on both sides,  we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f'(x)  = f(x) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now,  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac {f'(x) }{f(x)} = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now,  integrate "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int \dfrac {f'(x) }{f(x)} dx = \displaystyle \int 1 dx"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow \ln (f(x)) = x + C"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the constant of integration "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We get,  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = e^{x+C} \Rightarrow f(0) = e^{0+C}\Rightarrow e^C = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore,  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = e^x e^C = e^x(0) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence,  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(\ln 5) = \boxed{0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 10-seconds challenge-9

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can write "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{x^{2}+x+4}{x^{2}+x+1}=\frac{x^{2}+x+1+3}{x^{2}+x+1}=1+\frac{3}{x^{2}+x+1}
"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{x^{2}+x+4}{x^{2}+x+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be maximum "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^{2}+x+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be minimum."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So maximum value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{x^{2}+x+4}{x^{2}+x+1}= 1+\frac{3}{\frac{3}{4}}=1+4=\boxed{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is 10 sec method."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
